definitions.title: n. pr. gent.
definitions.body: 3rd ‘ son ’ of Cush acc. to Ge 10:7 ([[ה]]—[[ָ]]), = 1Ch 1:9 ([[א]]—[[ָ]]); identif. with Sabbaqa [Periplus maris Erythr.:27], Saubaqa Ptol:vi. 7, 38, or Sabata [Strabo:xvi. 42], Sabota [Plin:NH vi. § 155, xii. 63], old commercial city of S. Arabia, by Tuch Ku, but this = Sab. [[שבות]] (not ´[[ס]]) Levy-Os:ZMG xix (1865), 253; xx (1866), 273, cf. Hal:JAS 7, iv. 525; Glaser:Skizze ii. 252 f. prop. Safqa (Ptol:vi. 7, 30), near W. shore of Pers. Gulf; LXX Sabaqa, Sabata, Sebaqa. All uncertain conjectures.
